title: What are some good rap songs that don't have profanity or rap about sex, drugs and violence? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here are some of my favorite rap songs or songs with featuring rap with clean lyrics, 90-100% cuss word free and actually has substance (and most are also uplifting, positive, and encouraging on top of it :D): Put Me On - B.O.B  Be Me by Eric Heron  Rip It Up by Capital Kings ft Arron Cole  In All the Wrong Places by Kero One  Undefeated by Tauren Wells ft KB  I’ll Find You by Lecrae ft Tory Kelly  1, 2, Step - Ciara ft Missy… yea I still get down to this.  You Light Me Up by Open Sky….I hate to admit I like this but I do. It’s… not a good rap, and it’s super corny but Idk something about it has always made me happy. Lmao they are kinda of not even rapping.. it’s just talking. Yet.. I still felt the need to include it in the list lol  Alligator Sky by Owl City Ft Shawn Chrystopher  Alligator Sky by Owl City Ft B.O.B. (there’s two versions with two different rappers…this version isn’t as good as one solid piece I think, but I like the rap still)  Well.. that’s all I can think of for now, so hopefully you like at least one or some of these ones!

Back in my youth, I loved “Principal’s Office” by Young MC, his 1989/1990 hit single. It describes the day of a mischievous, i.e. totally normal schoolboy in his late teens: without profanity — nobody ever curses, the most aggressive line is a nurse saying “Whaddaya know?”without sex — the narrator is yet at base zero, i.e. the “passing notes” stage of the potential relationshipwithout drugs — the dealin’ in the line “give me a week, me and the girl will be dealin’” is about what he hopes will come from the love letterwithout violence — a tooth gets cracked, but that's the result of Thursday’s lunch, with the apple sauce being the prime suspect
